perturbation.original_text: Licensee owns and operates the following radio station (the “Station”) pursuant to licenses issued by the Federal Communications Commission (“FCC”): WQHT-FM, New York, NY (Facility ID No. 19615). The Station has the capability to transmit an in-band, on-channel (“IBOC”) digital broadcast signal.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee owns and operates the following broadcast outlet (the “Station”) pursuant to licenses issued by the Federal Communications Commission (“FCC”): WQHT-FM, New York, NY (Facility ID No. 19615). The broadcasting facility has the capability to transmit an in-band, on-channel (“IBOC”) digital broadcast signal.
perturbation.explanation: The terms “radio station” is replaced with “broadcast outlet” and 'Station' is replaced with 'broadcasting facility', which are used interchangeably without definition. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the scope of the agreement, particularly regarding regulatory compliance and operational responsibilities. It is unclear if 'broadcast outlet' and 'broadcasting facility' have the same meaning as 'radio station'.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, Programmer will obtain and maintain in full force and effect in its own name all necessary or appropriate music licenses with respect to the WLIB Programs rebroadcast on the HD2 Channel. Programmer represents and warrants to Licensee that Programmer has all rights in and to the WLIB Programs necessary or appropriate to rebroadcast such WLIB Programs on the HD2 Channel.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, the Content Provider will obtain and maintain in full force and effect in its own name all necessary or appropriate music licenses with respect to the WLIB Programs rebroadcast on the HD2 Channel. Programmer represents and warrants to Licensee that Programmer has all rights in and to the WLIB Programs necessary or appropriate to rebroadcast such WLIB Programs on the HD2 Channel.
perturbation.explanation: The term “Programmer” is replaced with “Content Provider”. This creates confusion over the entity responsible for music licenses. The original text clearly states that the 'Programmer' obtains the licenses. By replacing this with 'Content Provider' without defining it, it introduces a potential conflict, especially if 'Content Provider' and 'Programmer' are interpreted as different entities within the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Neither the Programmer nor Licensee will be deemed to be the agent, partner, or representative of the other party to this Agreement, and neither party is authorized to bind the other to any contract, agreement, or understanding.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither the Content Provider nor Licensee will be deemed to be the agent, partner, or representative of the other party to this Agreement, and neither party is authorized to bind the other to any contract, agreement, or understanding.
perturbation.explanation: The term “Programmer” is replaced with “Content Provider”. This has not been updated anywhere else. This creates confusion over the responsibilities between the 'Content Provider' and the 'Programmer'.
